sect1.title: Wireplumber-&wireplumber-version;

sect2.title: Installation of Wireplumber
sect2.para: Install Wireplumber by running the following commands:

screen.userinput:
mkdir build && cd build &&
meson setup --prefix=/usr --buildtype=release -Dsystem-lua=true .. && ninja

sect2.para: To test the results, issue: ninja test.

sect2.title: Command Explanations
sect2.para: -Dsystem-lua=true: This switch enables using the system version of Lua. Omit this switch if you have not installed Lua, but note that meson will download and install it's own version.

sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: In order for Wireplumber to be used by Pipewire, Wireplumber must be configured to start when a desktop environment is started.
To configure Wireplumber to start when a desktop environment is started, run the following commands as the &root; user to enable the systemd user units:

screen.userinput: systemctl enable --global pipewire.socket && systemctl enable --global wireplumber

sect3.para: First, create a shell script that will start Wireplumber and Pipewire in the correct order as the &root; user:

screen.userinput:
cat > /usr/bin/pipewire-launcher.sh << "EOF" #!/bin/sh # Begin /usr/bin/pipewire-launcher.sh
# Start Pipewire first. exec /usr/bin/pipewire &
# Wait for a second for Pipewire to launch. sleep 1
# Start Wireplumber now that Pipewire has been started. exec /usr/bin/wireplumber & # End /usr/bin/pipewire-launcher.sh EOF

sect3.para: Next, make this shell script executable as the &root; user:
Finally, create an XDG Autostart file that will run /usr/bin/pipewire-launcher.sh when a desktop environment is started, as the &root; user:

screen.userinput: cat > /etc/xdg/autostart/pipewire.desktop << "EOF" [Desktop Entry] Version=1.0 Name=Pipewire Comment=Starts the Pipewire and Wireplumber daemons Exec=/usr/bin/pipewire-launcher.sh Terminal=false Type=Application EOF

sect3.para: Now that Wireplumber is configured to start when a desktop environment is started, it is recommended that you log out of your session and log back in again.
